- ‚úÖ End-to-end workflows
- ‚ö†Ô∏è  MCP server integration (0 tests) - **Deferred to Session 11**

#### Edge Case Testing: 95/100 ‚≠ê Excellent
- ‚úÖ Empty states (empty KB, no tasks)
- ‚úÖ Invalid inputs (wrong category, invalid ID format)
- ‚úÖ Unicode/emoji handling (Êó•Êú¨Ë™û„ÄÅüöÄ)
- ‚úÖ Special characters (<>&"')
- ‚úÖ Large datasets (50+ entries, 20+ tasks)

#### Error Handling: 95/100 ‚≠ê Excellent
- ‚úÖ NotFoundError (non-existent entries/tasks)
- ‚úÖ ValidationError (invalid inputs)
- ‚úÖ DuplicateError (duplicate IDs)
- ‚úÖ Import error recovery (rollback, skip, abort modes)

#### Performance Testing: 40/100 ‚ö†Ô∏è Basic Only
- ‚úÖ Basic observation (50 entries tested)
- ‚ùå Large datasets (1000+ entries) - **Session 11**
- ‚ùå Concurrent access - **Session 11**

**Justification**: Performance testing deferred to Session 11 by design. Basic tests show acceptable performance.

#### Security Testing: 85/100 ‚úÖ Good
- ‚úÖ YAML safety (dangerous tags blocked)
- ‚úÖ Path validation (traversal prevention)
- ‚úÖ File permissions (600/700)
- ‚úÖ Bandit security scan (completed in Session 8)

## üí° Lessons Learned

### 1. Shared Fixtures Save Significant Time ‚úÖ
**Impact**: 40 tests in 3 hours (~7.5 min/test) due to ready-made fixtures

### 2. Integration Tests > Unit Tests for CLI ‚úÖ
**Impact**: Found more real issues (method names, missing flags) than unit tests would

### 3. Coverage-Driven Development Works ‚úÖ
**Impact**: Targeted testing increased KB from 72% to 93% in 12 tests

### 4. Documentation is Critical ‚úÖ
**Impact**: Comprehensive summaries enable future sessions to proceed efficiently

### 5. Plan with Verification ‚úÖ (From Session 9)
**Impact**: Avoided wasting time on already-covered modules

---
